channel.title: Shortening code
channel.description:
What's an easier way to write this?
[code]playerLevel[1] >= 99 || playerLevel[2] >= 99 || playerLevel[3] >= 99 || playerLevel[4] >= 99 || playerLevel[5] >= 99 || playerLevel[6] >= 99 || playerLevel[7] >= 99 || playerLevel[8] >= 99 || playerLevel[9] >= 99 || playerLevel[10] >= 99 || playerLevel[11] >= 99 || playerLevel[12] >= 99 || playerLevel[13] >= 99 || playerLevel[14] >= 99 || playerLevel[15] >= 99 || playerLevel[16] >= 99 || playerLevel[17] >= 99 || playerLevel[18] >= 99 || playerLevel[19] >= 99 || playerLevel[20] >= 99){[/code]
Like using:
[code]playerLevel[i] >= 99){ int i = playerLevel < 21[/code]
Something like that...

item.title: Shortening code
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

Try using something similar to this:

// Setting Levels if (i == 3) { playerLevel[i] = 10; playerXP[i] = 1155; currentHealth = 10; maxHealth = 10; } else { playerLevel[i] = 1; playerXP[i] = 0; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Shortening code
item.dc:creator: @Dalcian Dalcian
item.description:
@Dalcian wrote:

What’s an easier way to write this?

playerLevel[1] >= 99 || playerLevel[2] >= 99 || playerLevel[3] >= 99 || playerLevel[4] >= 99 || playerLevel[5] >= 99 || playerLevel[6] >= 99 || playerLevel[7] >= 99 || playerLevel[8] >= 99 || playerLevel[9] >= 99 || playerLevel[10] >= 99 || playerLevel[11] >= 99 || playerLevel[12] >= 99 || playerLevel[13] >= 99 || playerLevel[14] >= 99 || playerLevel[15] >= 99 || playerLevel[16] >= 99 || playerLevel[17] >= 99 || playerLevel[18] >= 99 || playerLevel[19] >= 99 || playerLevel[20] >= 99){

Like using:

playerLevel[i] >= 99){ int i = playerLevel < 21

Something like that…
